subject: Education
title: Epistemology: What Counts as Knowledge?
description: A short lesson to help you apply Epistemology: What Counts as Knowledge?.

hook.text: Is it knowledge if you feel it in your gut? If your culture says it? If a study proves it?

buildup.text: Epistemologyâ€”the study of knowledgeâ€”asks: what can we know, and how do we know it?

discovery.text: Schools traditionally prioritize propositional knowledge (facts) over procedural or personal knowledge.

twist.text: Indigenous knowledge systems include ecological wisdom that Western science is only now rediscovering.

climax.text: A truly inclusive curriculum recognizes multiple ways of knowing, not just the Western scientific one.

punchline.text: What you count as knowledge depends on who did the counting.
